page.title: 05CLOVA CHURCH OF SCOTLAND.
page.content: Clova Church is a single storied stone building with a wooden porch at the front. The church itself is 13m long and 8m wide. The roof is made of slates. On the roof of the porch there is a cross and on the roof of the church there is a bell and a cross. The church can seat about 154 people. There are 4 lattice windows facing South and 1 stained glass window facing East erected in 1968 in memory of local farmer William Edgar from Rottal. Two of his grand-daughters now attend Clova School. The church is in need of repair and has very few services; only occasional services at Easter and Christmas. The last wedding was in September 1979 when 2 Canadians were married, the last christening was in August 1983 and the last funeral was in 1971.
